Alias_List.Alias: cAMP-binding domains-Catabolite gene activator and regulatory subunit of cAMP-dependent protein kinases

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a nucleotide, any compound consisting of a nucleoside that is esterified with (ortho)phosphate or an oligophosphate at any hydroxyl group on the ribose or deoxyribose.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

Funtion.Detail: Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).
Catalysis of the transfer of a phosphate group, usually from ATP, to a substrate molecule.

Catalysis of the transfer of a group, e.g. a methyl group, glycosyl group, acyl group, phosphorus-containing, or other groups, from one compound (generally regarded as the donor) to another compound (generally regarded as the acceptor). Transferase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 2.
Modulation of the activity of the enzyme cAMP-dependent protein kinase.

BioProcess.Detail: The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.

PDB.PubMed_Title: The Crystal Structures of Apo and Camp-Bound Glxr from Corynebacterium Glutamicum Reveal Structural and Dynamic Changes Upon Camp Binding in Crp/Fnr Family Transcription Factors.
PDB.Author: Townsend, P.D., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal structure of GlxR transcription factor from Corynebacterium glutamicum with cAMP
PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structure of GlxR transcription factor from Corynebacterium glutamicum with cAMP
